druidConnection.description: a boolean config value to enable/disable connection for a service.

username.description: username to connect  to the Druid. This user should have privileges to read all the metadata in Druid.

password.description: password to connect to the Druid.

hostPort.description: Host and port of the Druid

database.description: Database of the data source. This is optional parameter, if you would like to restrict the metadata reading to a single database. When left blank , OpenMetadata Ingestion attempts to scan all the databases in Druid.

connectionOptions.description: Additional connection options that can be sent to service during the connection.

connectionArguments.description: Additional connection arguments such as security or protocol configs that can be sent to service during connection.
